name: 劉傳銘
objective: The course gives a broad introduction about the design and analysis of computer algorithms. General topics to be covered include: growth of functions, recurrences, sorting and order statistics, fundamental and advanced data structures, dynamic programming, greedy algorithms, graph searching and graph algorithms, concepts about NP-completeness.
schedule:
•Introduction (1 hour)
•Mathematics for Algorithms (5 hours)
•Data Structures (3 hours)
•Sorting and Selection (3 hours)
LAB 1 (3 hours)
•Searching (5 hours)
•Divide-and-Conquer (4 hours)
Midterm Exam (3 hours)
LAB 2 (3 hours)
•Greedy Algorithms (6 hours)
•Dynamic Programming (8 hours)
LAB 3 (3 hours)
•Introduction to P and NP (4 hours)
Final Exam (3 hours)
scorePolicy:
Assignments (30%): 4-5 homework sets
LABs (15%): 3 labs for implementing algorithm using C
Midterm (25%)
Final exam (30%)
materials:
Textbook (Required)

•Algorithms, R. Johnsonbaugh and M. Schaefer, Pearson Prentice Hall, 2004. ISBN: 0-13-122853-6.

Supplementary Textbooks 
•Algorithms, Sanjoy Dasgupta, Christos Papadimitriou, Umesh Vazirani, McGraw-Hill, 2008. ISBN:978-007-125975-0.
•The Design and Analysis of Algorithms, 2nd Edition, Anany Levitin, Addison Wesley, 2007. ISBN:0-321-36413-9

•Computer Algorithms, 3rd edition. S. Baase and A. V. Gelder. Addison-Wesley, 2000.
